articles.headline: Mexico and the U.S. Have Made Progress Toward Averting Tariffs
articles.snippet: They are discussing changes in asylum rules and border enforcement that could forestall the U.S. from imposing tariffs on Mexican imports, officials said.
articles.abstract: They are discussing changes in asylum rules and border enforcement that could forestall the U.S. from imposing tariffs on Mexican imports, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Mexico and the United States are discussing significant changes in asylum rules and border enforcement that could forestall President Trump from imposing tariffs on all Mexican imports, senior officials from both countries said Thursday.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Azam Ahmed

articles.headline: Meet the Money Whisperer to the Super-Rich N.B.A. Elite
articles.snippet: Who’s the guy Klay Thompson and other N.B.A. stars trust to manage their wealth? One who knows how to rebound with $8,000 stuffed into his underwear.
articles.abstract: Who’s the guy Klay Thompson and other N.B.A. stars trust to manage their wealth? One who knows how to rebound with $8,000 stuffed into his underwear.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every day of Joe McLean’s job, as the premier wealth manager of the N.B.A. elite, requires him to make the kind of purchases that most of us make only once or twice in a lifetime. He bought 25 cars on behalf of his clients last year, and he probably sold nearly as many. He closed on four houses in February alone. You wouldn’t believe how many pool tables he’s bought, let alone how many pools.

articles.headline: Trump Honors D-Day Sacrifices, With Some Legacies Unspoken
articles.snippet: While paying tribute to veterans, the president said little about the institutions built after World War II that are fraying under populist movements.
articles.abstract: While paying tribute to veterans, the president said little about the institutions built after World War II that are fraying under populist movements.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLLEVILLE-SUR-MER, France — Standing on a sun-drenched bluff above the Normandy beaches, where 10,000 soldiers sacrificed themselves to a savage fusillade of gunfire and opened the way for Europe’s liberation in 1944, President Trump declared on Thursday, “We are gathered here on freedom’s altar.”
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: How France’s Intrusive Demands Quashed the Fiat-Renault Deal
articles.snippet: Talks between Fiat Chrysler and Renault to create one of the world’s largest automakers ran into a familiar problem in France: the government itself.
articles.abstract: Talks between Fiat Chrysler and Renault to create one of the world’s largest automakers ran into a familiar problem in France: the government itself.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — It was supposed to be a transformative merger in an industry facing intractable challenges. But Fiat Chrysler and Renault ran headlong this week into a familiar problem in France: the government itself.

articles.headline: Joe Biden Denounces Hyde Amendment, Reversing His Position
articles.snippet: Mr. Biden had been one of only a few Democratic politicians who supported the amendment, which bans most federal funding for abortion.
articles.abstract: Mr. Biden had been one of only a few Democratic politicians who supported the amendment, which bans most federal funding for abortion.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — After two days of intense criticism, Joseph R. Biden Jr. reversed himself Thursday night on one of the issues most important to Democratic voters, saying he no longer supports a measure that bans federal funding for most abortions.

articles.headline: Few Talked About Race at This School. Then a Student Posted a Racist Slur.
articles.snippet: When white students at a Minnesota school posted a slur to Snapchat, black classmates demanded action. Their efforts led to uncomfortable conversations about race.
articles.abstract: When white students at a Minnesota school posted a slur to Snapchat, black classmates demanded action. Their efforts led to uncomfortable conversations about race.
articles.lead_paragraph: [For more coverage of race, sign up here to have our Race/Related newsletter delivered weekly to your inbox.]
articles.byline: By John Eligon and Jenn Ackerman

articles.headline: New Evidence of Age Bias in Hiring, and a Push to Fight It
articles.snippet: Digital recruiting is leaving more of a forensic trail in discrimination cases. But a wave of litigation is running up against higher legal hurdles.
articles.abstract: Digital recruiting is leaving more of a forensic trail in discrimination cases. But a wave of litigation is running up against higher legal hurdles.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Ala. — Across the United States, mammoth corporations and family businesses share a complaint: a shortage of workers. As the unemployment rate has tunneled its way to a half-century low, employers insist they must scramble to lure applicants.

articles.headline: Trump Allows High-Tech U.S. Bomb Parts to Be Built in Saudi Arabia
articles.snippet: Tucked into the administration’s emergency order to sell arms to Saudi Arabia is approval for Raytheon to build key components of precision-guided bombs with Saudi partners.
articles.abstract: Tucked into the administration’s emergency order to sell arms to Saudi Arabia is approval for Raytheon to build key components of precision-guided bombs with Saudi partners.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When the Trump administration declared an emergency last month and fast-tracked the sale of more American arms to Saudi Arabia, it did more than anger members of Congress who opposed the sale on humanitarian grounds.
articles.byline: By Michael LaForgia and Walt Bogdanich

articles.headline: A Weak Jobs Report Poses a New Challenge to Trump: A Slowing Economy
articles.snippet: A sharp decline in the pace of hiring in May, especially in sectors dependent on trade, suggests that the president’s tariffs are starting to bite.
articles.abstract: A sharp decline in the pace of hiring in May, especially in sectors dependent on trade, suggests that the president’s tariffs are starting to bite.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers, business executives and economists have all tried to warn President Trump that his trade policies could hurt growth. On Friday, the government reported that employers added just 75,000 jobs in May, a fact that will be hard for him to ignore.

articles.headline: Columbine High School Could Be Torn Down to Deter Copycats
articles.snippet: Calling the school “a source of inspiration” for potential gun violence, the school superintendent has suggested razing the site of the horrific 1999 shooting.
articles.abstract: Calling the school “a source of inspiration” for potential gun violence, the school superintendent has suggested razing the site of the horrific 1999 shooting.
articles.lead_paragraph: LITTLETON, Colo. — In the 20 years since the massacre at Columbine High School, the building has become a macabre tourist attraction for the curious and the obsessed. They travel from as far as Brazil or Japan, hoping to walk the halls, to look for the two teenage gunmen’s lockers. They come every day, and more come with each passing year.
articles.byline: By Julie Turkewitz and Jack Healy
